sense.gloss: Awaji (former province located on Awaji Island in present-day Hyōgo Prefecture)
uninterested, unconcerned, indifferent, dispassionate, matter-of-fact, detached
Ōmi (former province located in present-day Shiga Prefecture)
light and shade, shade (of colour, color)
depth (of flavor), complexity, strength and weakness (of flavor)
frank, candid, easygoing, unselfish, indifferent (to), not particular (about)

sdata.j: ↑塩水↑↓えんすい↓の↑方↑↓ほう↓が↑淡水↑↓たんすい↓よりも↑浮力↑↓ふりょく↓が↑大↑↓おお↓きい。
sdata.e: Salt water is more buoyant than fresh water.

sdata.j: その↑川↑↓かわ↓には↑淡水魚↑↓たんすいぎょ↓がうようよしていた。
sdata.e: The river was alive with fresh water fish.

sdata.j: サケは↑淡水↑↓たんすい↓で↑産卵↑↓さんらん↓する。
sdata.e: Salmon lay their eggs in fresh water.

sdata.j: これは↑確↑↓たし↓か↑淡水魚↑↓たんすいぎょ↓だと↑思↑↓おも↓います。
sdata.e: I believe this fish is a freshwater fish.

sdata.j: この↑装置↑↓そうち↓により、↑簡単↑↓かんたん↓に↑海水↑↓かいすい↓を↑淡水↑↓たんすい↓に↑変↑↓か↓えることが↑可能↑↓かのう↓となった。
sdata.e: This device made it possible to turn sea-water into fresh water easily.

sdata.j: ↑湖↑↓みずうみ↓や↑河↑↓かわ↓の↑水↑↓みず↓は、たいてい↑淡水↑↓たんすい↓である。
sdata.e: The water in lakes and rivers is usually fresh.

sdata.j: ↑鯉↑↓こい↓や↑鱒↑↓ます↓のような↑魚↑↓さかな↓は↑淡水↑↓たんすい↓に↑住↑↓す↓んでいる。
sdata.e: Such fishes as carp and trout live in fresh water.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑演説↑↓えんぜつ↓は↑冷淡↑↓れいたん↓な↑沈黙↑↓ちんもく↓で↑迎↑↓むか↓えられた。
sdata.e: My speech was greeted with cold silence.

sdata.j: ↑淡路↑↓あわじ↓で↑大↑↓だい↓↑地震↑↓じしん↓があったというニュースを↑聞↑↓き↓いた。
sdata.e: I heard the news that there had been a big earthquake in Awaji.

sdata.j: ↑日本人↑↓にっぽんじん↓は↑知↑↓し↓り↑合↑↓あ↓いには↑親切↑↓しんせつ↓だが、そうでない↑人↑↓ひと↓に↑対↑↓たい↓しては↑冷淡↑↓れいたん↓だと↑言↑↓い↓われています。
sdata.e: It is said that Japanese people are kind to people they know, but rather cold to those they don't.

words.gloss: Awaji (former province located on Awaji Island in present-day Hyōgo Prefecture)
uninterested, unconcerned, indifferent, dispassionate, matter-of-fact, detached
